title: The Marshmallow Test Revisited
description: A quick win: understand The Marshmallow Test Revisited.

hook.text: A 4-year-old stares at a marshmallow. Wait 15 minutes without eating it and get two.

buildup.text: Walter Mischel's 1972 Stanford experiment found that kids who delayed gratification had better SAT scores, health, and.

discovery.text: The children who succeeded used strategies: looking away, singing, reframing the marshmallow as a cloud.

twist.text: Recent replications showed environment matters too. Kids from unstable backgrounds had good reason not to trust the.

climax.text: Self-regulation isn't about white-knuckling through temptation.

punchline.text: Self-control isn't resisting temptation. It's outsmarting it.

quiz.question: What strategy did successful children use in the marshmallow test?
options: Cognitive strategies like reframing and distraction
